channel.title: Looking for people
channel.description:
I'm basically looking for people to do Video tutorials in a variety of computing areas. Depending on the area and how good they are, will also depend on payment which would be between 0.50 - 1$ per minute of video produced + other bonuses i.e a money bonuses after 5 have been completed.
I'm basically going to be restarting a tutorial/resource based site. Originally (for those that remember) rs-resources was set up to teach people how to make bots etc...But i started updating and releasing Aryan for free because i thought it stupid Mr Snellman was charging.
Sean greasley was always popular with beginners but 1. He never does anything new. 2. He doesn't really seem to know what he's doing anyway. 3. There's no community, forums or anything like that for support and help.
Topics would include: Html and Webdesign. C++ Java script Graphics SQL Other computer science topics(Not necessarily programming), if you have any idea's then feel free to share.
Each video would ideally need to be between 3 minutes and 10 mins.
If interested reply/pm me. And only people who have a decent amount of experience in their field.
Cheers

item.title: Looking for people
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Pookey71, post:51, topic:262287”][quote author=Taios link=topic=346387.msg2668550#msg2668550 date=1234715461]

video tutorials suck dick

I thought you were a community member?
Anyway, their much better then to get started with than text books.
[/quote]Depends on the person. Video Tutorials are more suited for illiterate kids than normal people.

Having something taught to you i find is much easier. Like learning things like Advanced maths from books can be tricky, especially if they don’t give you examples.

But yea, thats why i’m going to have the site have a mixture(text based and video) =), but also videos i think are good for anyone and everyone :)(beginner wise)

But for the more advanced, text stuff is in my opinion defiantly better.

I cannot learn from video, I have to read it to be able to learn. Seriously, video’s are just slow and repetitive. At least while you can read a book and go at your own pace you have to go into some type of wtfery with video’s.[/quote]
Everyone learn different, I like video tuts and much better than reading boring text, but you need to be able to skip the boring repetitive part as you mention(If it is made good you don’t even need to skip anything).

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for people
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

This sounds like a good idea, but considering I don’t know much in any programming language (I know the basics in Java, C#, etc) I can’t really help =/

But I would watch. And for those who are saying “HD, I CANT DO THAT” yes you can.

Free Cam Recorder: http://camstudio.org/

Its amazing, you just have to set some settings, or your voice will be off. Just google it. And just set the res. can just be your whole desktop.

item.title: Looking for people
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:28, topic:262287”][quote author=Taios link=topic=346387.msg2668550#msg2668550 date=1234715461]
Having something taught to you i find is much easier. Like learning things like Advanced maths from books can be tricky, especially if they don’t give you examples.
[/quote]

Video tutorials and someone teaching you are completely different. A teacher can see on your face whether you understand it or not, and he/she can change the level to your needs. It’s dynamical teaching. A video tutorial is the same as a book: Statical.[/quote]

I’ve struggled to understand teaching by my teachers. Maths for example, however having signed up for www.livemaths.co.uk which provide video tutorials on maths, i’ve excelled and ended up receiving an A in maths and an A in further maths which enables me into a top university in the country.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for people
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Taios:

Having something taught to you i find is much easier. Like learning things like Advanced maths from books can be tricky, especially if they don’t give you examples.

Video tutorials and someone teaching you are completely different. A teacher can see on your face whether you understand it or not, and he/she can change the level to your needs. It’s dynamical teaching. A video tutorial is the same as a book: Statical.

Read full topic
